storage::ittiadb::Table Class Reference

Access a table in the database. The Table class is used to access all data stored in a table. A Table object can be used to read rows one at a time, search for indexed data, and insert new rows. More...

Detailed Description

Access a table in the database. The Table class is used to access all data stored in a table. A Table object can be used to read rows one at a time, search for indexed data, and insert new rows.

Member Enumeration Documentation

◆ LockMode

enum storage::ittiadb::Table::LockMode

An enum Lock Mode.

Enumerator
Shared 

Obtain shared locks when possible.

Exclusive 

Obtain exclusive locks only.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Table()

storage::ittiadb::Table::Table ( Connection &  connection,
const char *  name 
)

Create an object to access a table in the database.

Parameters
connectionA database connection object. The connection must be opened before any member functions can be used.
nameTable name. A name must start with a letter and can be followed by one or more letters, numbers, or underscores.

Member Function Documentation

◆ exists()

bool storage::ittiadb::Table::exists ( )

Determines whether a table exists in the database.

Returns
  • true if a table exists.
  • false if table does not exist.

◆ open() [1/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::open ( db_flags_t  flags = 0)
inline

Obtain a cursor to access the data in a table.

Parameters
flagsTable cursor lock mode flags
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, invalid params->flags.
    • DB_ENAME Invalid name.
    • DB_EINDEX Unable to find cursor index using name sepcified.
Note
When no longer needed, the table must be closed with close.

◆ open() [2/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::open ( Table::LockMode  lock_mode)
inline

Obtain a cursor to access the data in a table with a given lock mode.

Parameters
lock_modeLock mode
  • Shared Obtain shared locks when possible.
  • Exclusive Obtain exclusive locks only.
Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, invalid params->flags.
    • DB_ENAME Invalid name.
    • DB_EINDEX Unable to find cursor index using name sepcified.
Note
When no longer needed, the table must be closed with close.

◆ close()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::close ( )

Closes the cursor handle obtained to access data in table.

Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle.

◆ is_open()

bool storage::ittiadb::Table::is_open ( ) const
inline

Checks if table cursor is obtained.

Returns
  • true if a table cursor is obtained.
  • false if a table cursor is not obtained.

const data::RowDefinition & storage::ittiadb::Table::columns ( ) const

Returns collection of field definitions.

Returns
Row schema definition (collection of field definitions)

◆ insert() [1/3]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::insert ( data::Row &  row)

Inserts the data in row into the table and the cursor stay at the current record whatever it is.

Parameters
rowRow of values for insert. Unbound fields will be treated as null.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ESTATE The cursor does not support insert operations.
    • DB_EINDVALUE Invalid length indicator(*ind_ptr) value in row.
    • DB_ENULLFIELD Insert would violate a NOT NULL constraint.Use a value that is not null.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ insert() [2/3]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::insert ( data::Row &  row,
data::Row &  actual_row 
)

Inserts the data in row into the table , position the cursor on inserted row and fetch actual current row.

Parameters
rowRow of values for insert. Unbound fields will be treated as null.
actual_rowreturns Row of values fetched after insert success
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ESTATE The cursor does not support insert operations.
    • DB_EINDVALUE Invalid length indicator(*ind_ptr) value in row.
    • DB_ENULLFIELD Insert would violate a NOT NULL constraint.Use a value that is not null.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ update_by_index() [1/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::update_by_index ( const data::Row &  keys,
data::Row &  row 
)
inline

Update the contents of row keys in table using the data in row.

Parameters
keysRow of keys to seek in table. Unbound fields will be treated as null.
rowRow of values for update. Unbound fields will be treated as null.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure or row keys not found in table

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ESTATE The cursor does not support update operations.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ delete_by_index() [1/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::delete_by_index ( const data::Row &  keys)
inline

Delete given row from the table.

Parameters
keysRow to be deleted from table
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure or row keys not found in table

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ESTATE The cursor does not support update operations.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND Given row not found in table
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ search_by_index() [1/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::search_by_index ( db_seek_t  seek,
const data::Row &  key,
data::Row &  destination 
)
inline

Search for a row matching the criteria given in the row key and fetch into the row destination. The cursor is positioned on the first table row that is in the relationship seek to the data in key.

Parameters
seek
  • DB_SEEK_LESS
  • DB_SEEK_LESS_OR_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_FIRST_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_LAST_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_GREATER
  • DB_SEEK_GREATER_OR_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_EQUAL
keyRow of search values.
destinationDestination for fetched data.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND Cursor is not positioned on a row.No data was read.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ search_by_index() [2/4]

template<typename T >
db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::search_by_index ( const data::Row &  key,
data::RowSet< T > &  destination 
)
inline

Search for a row set matching the range of index given in the row key and fetch into the row set destination.

Parameters
keyRow of search values.
destinationDestination for fetched set of row data.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND Cursor is not positioned on a row.No data was read.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ update_by_index() [3/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::update_by_index ( const data::Row &  key,
int  index_fields,
data::Row &  row 
)

Update table with row with number of index field match.

Parameters
keyA Row with keys
index_fieldsThe first index_fields fields in the cursor's index will be used to find a match for update.
rowA Row with data
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ESTATE The cursor does not support update operations.
    • DB_EINDEX Index not available.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND No rows match the search criteria.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ delete_by_index() [3/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::delete_by_index ( const data::Row &  key,
int  index_fields 
)

Delete row in the table with number of index field match against keys.

Parameters
keyA Row with keys
index_fieldsThe first index_fields fields in the cursor's index will be used to find a match for update.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ESTATE The cursor does not support update operations.
    • DB_EINDEX Index not available.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND No rows match the search criteria.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

Delete set of row in the table with number of index field match against keys in row set keys.

◆ search_by_index() [3/4]

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::search_by_index ( db_seek_t  seek,
const data::Row &  key,
int  index_fields,
data::Row &  destination 
)

Search for a row matching index_fields and the criteria given in the row key
then fetch into the row destination. The cursor is positioned on the first table
row that is in the relationship seek to the data in key.

Parameters
seek
  • DB_SEEK_LESS
  • DB_SEEK_LESS_OR_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_FIRST_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_LAST_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_GREATER
  • DB_SEEK_GREATER_OR_EQUAL
  • DB_SEEK_EQUAL
keyRow of search values.
index_fieldsThe first index_fields fields in the cursor's index will be used to find a match.
destinationDestination for fetched data.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND Cursor is not positioned on a row.No data was read.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

◆ search_by_index() [4/4]

template<typename T >
db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::search_by_index ( const data::Row &  key,
int  index_fields,
data::RowSet< T > &  destination 
)
inline

Search for a row set with matching the range of index index_fields given in the row key and fetch into the row set destination.

Parameters
keyRow of search values.
index_fieldsThe first index_fields fields in the cursor's index will be used to find a match.
destinationDestination for fetched set of row data.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND Cursor is not positioned on a row.No data was read.
Postcondition
A transaction is active on database if the operation succeeds.

inline

Fetch all rows into a RowSet or the first row into a SingleRow.

Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

    • DB_ENOTFOUND Cursor is not positioned on a row.No data was read.

◆ clone_data()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::clone_data ( Table &  source)

Replace the contents of this table with all rows in a source table.

Parameters
sourceA source table
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid cursor handle, invalid row handle.
    • DB_ENOTFOUND Cursor is not positioned on a row.No data was read.
Precondition
  • Both this and source must be open.
  • Both this and source must have identical columns.

◆ get_info()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::get_info ( db_cursor_info_t &  cursor_info) const
inline

Get information about the table.

Parameters
[out]cursor_infoDestination for table information.
Precondition
The table is open.

◆ create()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::create ( const db_tabledef_t &  tabledef)

Create the table from a table definition.

Parameters
tabledefA Table definition
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, table name is null, table definition is null, fields in table definition is null, field count in table definition <= 0.
    • DB_ENAME Table name is not in a valid format.
    • DB_EFIELD Invalid field name.
    • DB_ERECORDSIZE Record size too large for chosen page size.
    • DB_EDUPLICATE Table with given name already exists.
    • DB_ETXSTATE A write transaction is active.The transaction must be committed or rolled back before altering the schema.
Invariant
No transaction is active.
Note
This function does not create indexes, unless the table is clustered, or foreign keys.Use create_indexes and create_foreign_keys to add indexes and foreign keys to the table after it has been created. If tabledef->table_type is DB_TABLETYPE_CLUSTERED, a clustering index must be supplied in tabledef->indexes.The index_mode for that index must be set to DB_CLUSTERING_INDEX | DB_PRIMARY_INDEX and all index fields must have the flag DB_NOT_NULL.
Precondition
The table is not open.

◆ create_indexes()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::create_indexes ( const db_indexdef_t *  begin,
const db_indexdef_t *  end 
)

Add indexes to the table.

Parameters
beginStart address of an array for index definition
endEnd address of an array for index definition
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, table is null, index name is null, index configuration is null .
    • DB_ENAME Invalid name.
    • DB_EFIELD Number of fields in index definition <= 0, index field can not be of blob type.
    • DB_EINDEX Index error.Can not have duplicate indexes.
    • DB_ELOCKED Table is locked by cursor or concurrent transaction.
    • DB_ETXSTATE A write transaction is active.The transaction must be committed or rolled back before altering the schema.
Note
If begin->index_mode or end->index_mode is DB_PRIMARY_INDEX, all index fields must have been created with the flag DB_NOT_NULL. Only one index can be created with the DB_PRIMARY_INDEX flag.
Precondition
The table is not open.

◆ create_foreign_keys()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::create_foreign_keys ( const db_foreign_key_def_t *  begin,
const db_foreign_key_def_t *  end 
)

Add foreign keys to the table.

Parameters
beginStart address of an array for foreign key definition
endEnd address of an array for foreign key definition
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, null table name, null foreign key definition, or bad foreign key definition.
    • DB_ETXSTATE A write transaction is active.The transaction must be committed or rolled back before altering the schema.
Precondition
The table is not open.

◆ drop()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Table::drop ( )

Drop the table.

Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle.
    • DB_ENAME Table name is not in a valid format.
    • DB_ELOCKED Table is locked by cursor or concurrent transaction.
    • DB_ETXSTATE A write transaction is active.The transaction must be committed or rolled back before altering the schema.
Precondition
The table is not open.
